clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Bright Light Therapy on Fatigue, Sleep and Circadian Activity Rhythms in Lung Cancer Survivors
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Bright Light Therapy on Fatigue, Sleep and Circadian Activity Rhythms in Lung Cancer Survivors

lead_sponsor.agency: State University of New York at Buffalo

clinical_study.source: State University of New York at Buffalo

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the effects of morning bright light therapy on fatigue, sleep disturbances, and circadian activity rhythms in lung cancer survivors.

detailed_description.textblock: A randomized controlled trial to test the effects of morning bright light therapy on fatigue, sleep disturbances, and circadian activity rhythms in lung cancer survivors.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in fatigue symptoms with Fatigue Severity Index from pre-test to post-test
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of fatigue severity from pre-test to post-test.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in sleep quality with the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index from pre-test to post-test
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of Sleep Quality from pre-test to post-test.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in insomnia with Insomnia Severity Index from pre-test to post-test
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of insomnia from pre-test to post-test.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in circadian activity rhythms with actigraphy from pre-test to post-test
primary_outcome.description: Circadian Activity Rhythms will be assessed with actigraphy during the 5-week time frame.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessement of chronotype with the Morningness versus Eveningness Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Chronotype will be assessed at baseline for a descriptive analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Environmental light with actigraphy (Actiwatch Spectrum Respironics)
secondary_outcome.description: Exposure to environmental light will be assessed at pre-test, intervention and post-test for a descriptive analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Quality of Life with theFunctional Assessment of Cancer Therapy - Lung
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of Life will be assessed before, during, and after the intervention.

other_outcome.measure: Assessment of Visual acuity with the Snellen visual acuity chart
other_outcome.description: Visual acuity data will be collected and save for safety purposes only at pre-test and post-test.

other_outcome.measure: Assessment of daytime sleepiness with the Epworth Sleepiness Scale
other_outcome.description: Daytime Sleepiness will be assessed for safety purposes only at pre-test, intervention and post-test. Individuals with high daytime sleepiness and/or at risk of falling asleep while driving or performing hazardous activities will be referred out to primary care

arm_group.description: Exposure to morning bright light therapy delivered with Green-Blue Re-Timer glasses for 30 minutes in the morning during one week.
Exposure to dim light delivered with Red-Yellow Re-Timer glasses for 30 minutes in the morning during one week.

intervention.description: Exposure to morning bright light therapy delivered with Green-Blue Re-Timer glasses for 30 minutes in the morning during one week.
Exposure to dim light with Red-Yellow Re-Timer glasses for 30 minutes in the morning during one week.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Stage I-III Non-small cell lung cancer survivors
- Must be at >6-weeks and < 3 years post-surgical resection
- Must have diagnosis fatigue and/or sleep disturbances
Exclusion Criteria:
- Individuals clinically unstable.
- Mania, Bipolar disease or seizure disorder
- Macular degeneration or glaucoma.
- Currently receiving chemotherapy or radiation.
